result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden L. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed/stayed, with huber.  Consecutive to any other sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Conditions:

Pay costs of supervision and court costs.  Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Follow all rules/regulations of agent.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming required by agent.  

Defendant to submit to booking/printing at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden L. Evans

from agent to clerk and back re def's payment on restitution (DOC collect or clerk collect?) - clerk clarifies to DOC that 14CF70 is a DOC-collect case while the restitution due in 13CF48 has been ordered collected by Clerk of Court
From DOC re: clarification of probationary term

ADDRESS INFO for Branden L. Evans
Current: 28382 Klinzing Lane, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2015)
Prior: 440 S. Ash Street, Lone Rock, WI 53556

Defendant Branden L. Evans in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

13CF48 - revocation of probation counts and status on DPA count; 14CF70 - status.  

Atty. M states the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of all three matters in these two cases.  Atty. M states that the parties' joint recommendation calls for 6 mo jail, concurrent, on cts 2 and 3 and 40 days concurrent on ct 4 in 13CF48; on DPA count, which is subject to revocation motion of state; counsel jointly ask for 12 mo imposed/stayed jail, consecutive to any other sentence, for 4 years probation with conditions to include agent's recommendation and no contact with victims of that case.  In 14CF70, Atty. M states joint recomm. is for 4 mo imposed/stayed jail, consecutive to any other sentence, and stayed for probation of 4 years with conditions as deemed appropriate by the agent.  Atty. M asks that, if def succ. completes probation, expungement is requested.

DA states prelim needs to be completed in 14CF70.  Atty. M presents court with plea questionnaire/waiver, as well as information filed by the State.

13CF48 - DA advises the Court that the basis for the bail jumping is a theft that the def committed in Grant County.  DA advises the Court of the victim's concerns/input in this matter.

14CF70 - Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy with def.  Prelim waiver accepted and bindover order for finding of probable cause, etc.  Plea waiver colloquy.  Formal reading of information waived.  Court states charge.  Def pleads no contest.  Further colloquy.

13CF48 - DA states def is entitled to 0 days credit; def was not subject to custody after revocation of probation.  There is no credit on the 6 mo jail being requested.

Discussion re which agency shall collect the restitution on the probation-revoked counts in 13CF48.  Clerk will collect it, not probation.  Probation will only collect on those counts in which DOC supervises.

Atty. M addresses Court; asks Court to allow def 30 days to report to jail.  Also asks for huber and expungement upon succ. completion of probation.  Ask that imposed/stayed JOCs reflect huber as well.

Court follows joint agreement and orders the following:
13CF48 - Count 2 - 6 mo county jail with huber; Count 3 - 6 mo jail, concurrent; Count 4 - 90 days jail, concurrent, with huber.  Costs $243/count, to be paid to clerk.  Restitution of $3913.50, to be collected by COC.

Count 1 - diversion agreement count - Court imposes 12 mo jail but stays it for probation of 4 years.  No contact with GG.  Obey rules/regs of probation.  Attend, pay for, succ. complete any programs as ordered by agent.  Submit DNA sample.  Pay costs including $250 DNA surcharge.

14CF70 - Court imposes and stays 4 mo jail with huber, consecutive to any other sentence, stayed for probation of 4 years probation with same conditions as previous.  Submit DNA sample.  Pay costs including $250 DNA surcharge. Complete booking before leaving courthouse today.

Court orders 973.015 for expungement upon def's successful completion of probation.  

Firearm admonishment provided.

Jail stayed for 30 days - def to report on or before May 1, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.
status rescheduling requested by Atty. McDougal without objection from DA Harper
Status conference on February 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal - motion to revoke DPA in 13CF48 and initial appearance in 14CF70.   DA states that parties will be resolving these matters but will need time on the calendar - not a criminal Wed. date.

14CF70 - initial appr conducted - formal reading waived; prelim time limits waived. 

Status requested and set - both matters - Tuesday, Dec. 2 at 9:15.  Status conference scheduled for 12-02-2014 at 09:15 am.
